title: Does successful reports boost your honor?
body:
So season 7, was a bit toxic, didn't get to honor 5 in time for the ward.
last season, I climbed to honor 5 at a rapid pace with the same behavior, yet I noticed more of my reports went through (based on the amount of messages that confirmed it).

title^

replies.body:
While we don't have a concrete evident answer, I hope the answer is no.

Also, comparing 7 and 8 Honor climb isn't good because of the frame for both. It was implemented later in 7 and you had a whole year, plus a head start in 8.

> [{quoted}](name=Imperial Pandaa,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NmaRKNxG,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-01-15T04:38:08.389+0000)
>
> While we don't have a concrete evident answer, I hope the answer is no.
> 
> Also, comparing 7 and 8 Honor climb isn't good because of the frame for both. It was implemented later in 7 and you had a whole year, plus a head start in 8.

I started Honor 2 1/3 and got to Honor 5 at the time of september.
S8 (in my opinion) was harder to climb, since you had to go through 3 checkpoints per rank.
comparing to my previous performance, SEVERLY BETTER.

idk about increasing honor rate but I know having a successful report automatically unlocks your honor. I had been honor locked and after one of my reports made contact and getting a confirmation that the player was punished my honor was unlocked.

I wouldn't really assume that managing a valid report would unlock Honor. For one, unlocking/progressing in Honor is more about your own behavior than anything else, and on top of that, if valid reports _did_ unlock Honor, then that would probably wind up rewarding instigators, which isn't really something Riot would do.

I'd reckon that your Honor unlocking at the same time as getting an Instant Feedback Report is just coincidence - correlation, not causation.

As far as we know the way to earn honor is to not be validly reported, with constant end screen honors _slightly_ speeding up the process.
I do hope in the future serial reporters (people creating non-valid reports in an unusually large quantity) should have their own honor halted a little simply so that the whole system is not so cluttered with reports that have to be processed, but that is just a personal hope and opinion.
